children.subject:
ReUSE (student-run thrift store and club in MLK) will be open and accepting new members in summer (starting in July) to do easy volunteering :)

Contact: reuse.berkeley.edu, ucberkeleyreuse@gmail.com
You can join the Student Food Pantry as a summer volunteer! They're an awesome org and apps are open to anybody.

Hey! If you're interested in the cross section between STEM and outreach, I'd like to plug in Pioneers in Engineering! We do a lot of different things, but we're most well known for the annual Robotics Competition we host for local Bay Area high schools in the Spring. It's similar to FIRST Robotics, if you're familiar with that, and we aim to provide a great experience and an entry point accessible to under served high schools and communities.

Some of the things you can do in this club include education (working on educational curriculum and managing our outreach programs), engineering (we build a robotics base kit from scratch including all the hardware, software, and programming environment for the students to use), and business (we have a huge budget and are always looking to raise more money for our cause). It's also not a huge club and it's super easy to find people who like doing the same things you do! We host a number of socials and really encourage teams and members to get to know each other more! It's also a volunteer based organization, so we don't have an application. You can put in a lot of time in to this club and it will be super rewarding, but if you just want to help out a couple hours a week we are also happy to have your help!

The club meets every Wednesday from 7-9 PM, and every Saturday from 1-3 PM during the semester. During the summer we meet only on Saturdays, and our worksessions will be starting soon. I've linked our website above, but specifically you can learn more about joining here: https://pioneers.berkeley.edu/get-involved/.

Feel free to ask any questions here, or email recruiting@pioneers.berkeley.edu

history.content: I'm interning in Berkeley this summer and was curious if there are any clubs (technical or non-technical) that meet or have events during the summer that are open for people to join or are open for non-members to participate in.
history.subject: Clubs that meet during Summer?
